benchmark_details.name: MedSafetyBench
benchmark_details.overview: MedSafetyBench is the first benchmark dataset designed to measure the medical safety of large language models (LLMs), introduced to evaluate and improve their safety in medical contexts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and improve the medical safety of large language models (LLMs) in medical settings.

data.source: Developed from a combination of GPT-4 and Llama-2-7b-chat using adversarial techniques.
data.annotation: Generated manually and semi-automatically verified for quality.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on the willingness of LLMs to comply with harmful requests from the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: A lower harmfulness score indicates a safer response.
methodology.validation: User study with 25 medical experts validated the dataset's alignment with medical ethics.

harm: Potential medical harm from LLMs failing safety standards
